cards.name: Charging Troll
cards.text:
Vigilance
{G}: Regenerate Charging Troll.
cards.flavor: They stop for nothing, not even the end of a battle.
cards.originalText:
Attacking doesn't cause Charging Troll to tap.
{G}: Regenerate Charging Troll.

cards.name: Cinder Shade
cards.text:
{B}: Cinder Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{R}, Sacrifice Cinder Shade: It deals damage equal to its power to target creature.
cards.originalText:
{B}: Cinder Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{R}, Sacrifice Cinder Shade: Cinder Shade deals damage equal to its power to target creature.

cards.name: Coalition Victory
cards.text: You win the game if you control a land of each basic land type and a creature of each color.
cards.flavor:
"You can build a perfect machine out of imperfect parts."
—Urza

rulings.text: When Coalition Victory resolves, it checks for the five basic land types (Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, Forest) and the five colors (white, blue, black, red, green). If a single land has multiple types and/or a single creature is multiple colors, it will count all those types and/or colors.

cards.originalText: You win the game if you control a land of each basic land type and a creature of each color.

cards.name: Crosis, the Purger
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Crosis, the Purger deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{B}. If you do, choose a color, then that player reveals their hand and discards all cards of that color.

rulings.text: You choose the color during resolution. This means your opponent does not get to react after knowing the color you chose.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Crosis, the Purger deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{B}. If you do, choose a color. That player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of that color from it.

cards.name: Darigaaz, the Igniter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Darigaaz, the Igniter deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, choose a color, then that player reveals their hand and Darigaaz deals damage to the player equal to the number of cards of that color revealed this way.

rulings.text: You choose the color during resolution. This means your opponent does not get to react after knowing the color you chose.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Darigaaz, the Igniter deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, choose a color. That player reveals his or her hand and Darigaaz deals X damage to him or her, where X is the number of cards revealed of that color.

cards.name: Dromar, the Banisher
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Dromar, the Banisher deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{U}. If you do, choose a color, then return all creatures of that color to their owners' hands.

rulings.text: You choose the color during resolution. This means your opponent does not get to react after knowing the color you chose.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Dromar, the Banisher deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{U}. If you do, choose a color. Return all creatures of that color to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Dueling Grounds
cards.text:
No more than one creature can attack each combat.
No more than one creature can block each combat.
cards.flavor:
"You think you can stop me?" hissed Tsabo.
"I think I can kill you," replied Gerrard.

rulings.text: The ability affects all players.

cards.originalText:
No more than one creature may attack each turn.
No more than one creature may block each turn.

cards.name: Fires of Yavimaya
cards.text:
Creatures you control have haste.
Sacrifice Fires of Yavimaya: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Creatures you control have haste. (They may attack and {T} the turn they come under your control.)
Sacrifice Fires of Yavimaya: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Frenzied Tilling
cards.text: Destroy target land. Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"Beneath her scars, Dominaria's beauty yet shines."
—Multani, maro-sorcerer

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
If the target land is an illegal target when Frenzied Tilling tries to resolve, the spell won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't search your library for a basic land card.

cards.originalText: Destroy target land. Search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Galina's Knight
cards.text: Protection from red
cards.flavor:
"Are they on our side?" asked Sisay.
"If they kill Phyrexians they are," replied Gerrard.
cards.originalText: Protection from red

cards.name: Hanna, Ship's Navigator
cards.text: {1}{W}{U}, {T}: Return target artifact or enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "I never thought I'd spend my life fighting. I'm a maker, not a destroyer."
cards.originalText: {1}{W}{U}, {T}: Return target artifact or enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Heroes' Reunion
cards.text: Target player gains 7 life.
cards.flavor:
"You helped save my people from a Phyrexian fate. Did you think I wouldn't return the favor?"
—Eladamri, to Gerrard
cards.originalText: Target player gains 7 life.

cards.name: Horned Cheetah
cards.text: Whenever Horned Cheetah deals damage, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor: "I think she wants us to eat it," said Squee, staring at the oily carcass the cheetah had dragged to their fire.
cards.originalText: Whenever Horned Cheetah deals damage, you gain that much life.

cards.name: Hunting Kavu
cards.text: {1}{R}{G}, {T}: Exile Hunting Kavu and target creature without flying that's attacking you.
cards.flavor: Dominarians gladly fought alongside kavu . . . until the kavu figured out some Dominarians were quite tasty.

rulings.text: Being "without flying" is a targeting restriction. The ability won't resolve if the target gains flying before the ability resolves.

cards.originalText: {1}{R}{G}, {T}: Remove from the game Hunting Kavu and target creature without flying that's attacking you.

cards.name: Kangee, Aerie Keeper
cards.text:
Kicker {X}{2} (You may pay an additional {X}{2} as you cast this spell.)
Flying
When Kangee, Aerie Keeper enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, put X feather counters on it.
Other Bird creatures get +1/+1 for each feather counter on Kangee, Aerie Keeper.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {2}{X} (You may pay an additional {2}{X} as you play this spell.)
Flying
When Kangee, Aerie Keeper comes into play, if you paid the kicker cost, put X feather counters on it.
All Birds get +1/+1 for each feather counter on Kangee, Aerie Keeper.

cards.name: Llanowar Knight
cards.text: Protection from black
cards.flavor: Her armor and steed were borrowed, but her courage was hers alone.
cards.originalText: Protection from black

cards.name: Lobotomy
cards.text: Target player reveals their hand, then you choose a card other than a basic land card from it. Search that player's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as the chosen card and exile them. Then that player shuffles their library.

rulings.text: You only get to pick one card from the player's hand.
If the player has no cards in their hand, you still get to look through their deck, but you do not get to exile any cards.
It exiles the chosen card plus all others in the hand, library, and graveyard. Some people thought the chosen card was not exiled due to some vague wording.
Does not affect cards on the battlefield.
The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

cards.originalText: Look at target player's hand and choose a card other than a basic land card from it. Search that player's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as the chosen card and remove them from the game. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Meteor Storm
cards.text: {2}{R}{G}, Discard two cards at random: Meteor Storm deals 4 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: The storm wasn't an omen. It was the fulfillment of one.
cards.originalText: {2}{R}{G}, Discard two cards at random from your hand: Meteor Storm deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Noble Panther
cards.text: {1}: Noble Panther gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Unlike many hunters, these panthers have no need for camouflage. They're fast enough to catch any prey.
cards.originalText: {1}: Noble Panther gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Ordered Migration
cards.text: Domain — Create a 1/1 blue Bird creature token with flying for each basic land type among lands you control.
cards.flavor: "Birds reach all parts of the world," said Barrin. "They will make excellent scouts."

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: Put a 1/1 blue Bird creature token with flying into play for each basic land type among lands you control.

cards.name: Overabundance
cards.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana of any type that land produced, and Overabundance deals 1 damage to the player.

rulings.text: The ability deals one damage even if the land produces no mana when it was tapped to use a mana ability. This can happen with lands that produce a variable amount of mana.

This card's ability is a mana ability. There is no chance to respond to it in order to prevent the damage. If you want to prevent the damage, you need to use a prevention spell or ability prior to tapping the land for mana.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one additional mana to his or her mana pool of the same type, and Overabundance deals 1 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Plague Spores
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature and target land. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"Breathe deep, Dominaria. Breathe deep and die."
—Tsabo Tavoc, Phyrexian general
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature and target land. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Pyre Zombie
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Pyre Zombie is in your graveyard, you may pay {1}{B}{B}. If you do, return Pyre Zombie to your hand.
{1}{R}{R}, Sacrifice Pyre Zombie: It deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Pyre Zombie is in your graveyard, you may pay {1}{B}{B}. If you do, return Pyre Zombie from your graveyard to your hand.
{1}{R}{R}, Sacrifice Pyre Zombie: Pyre Zombie deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Raging Kavu
cards.text:
Flash
Haste
cards.flavor: It took Yavimaya a thousand years to breed them, but it took only seconds for them to prove their worth.
cards.originalText:
Haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)
You may play Raging Kavu any time you could play an instant.

cards.name: Reckless Assault
cards.text: {1}, Pay 2 life: Reckless Assault deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"How will you fight an enemy that cares nothing for itself?"
—The Blind Seer
cards.originalText: {1}, Pay 2 life: Reckless Assault deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Recoil
cards.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand. Then that player discards a card.
cards.flavor: Anything sent into a plagued world is bound to come back infected.
cards.originalText: Return target permanent to its owner's hand. Then that player discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Reviving Vapors
cards.text: Reveal the top three cards of your library and put one of them into your hand. You gain life equal to that card's converted mana cost. Put all other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.
cards.originalText: Reveal the top three cards of your library and put one of them into your hand. You gain life equal to that card's converted mana cost. Put the other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.

cards.name: Riptide Crab
cards.text:
Vigilance
When Riptide Crab dies, draw a card.
cards.flavor: It sleeps with its claws open.
cards.originalText:
Attacking doesn't cause Riptide Crab to tap.
When Riptide Crab is put into a graveyard from play, draw a card.

cards.name: Rith, the Awakener
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Rith, the Awakener deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{G}. If you do, choose a color, then create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token for each permanent of that color.

rulings.text: You choose the color during resolution. This means your opponent does not get to react after knowing the color you chose.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Rith, the Awakener deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{G}. If you do, choose a color. Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play for each permanent of that color.

cards.name: Sabertooth Nishoba
cards.text: Trample, protection from blue and from red
cards.flavor: They sneer at the terrestrial dangers found on peaks and shores, eager to prove themselves against new and even mightier foes.
cards.originalText: Trample, protection from blue, protection from red

cards.text:
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
{T}: Samite Archer deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: "I can preserve ten lives by taking one."
cards.originalText:
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
{T}: Samite Archer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Seer's Vision
cards.text:
Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
Sacrifice Seer's Vision: Look at target player's hand and choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.originalText:
All opponents play with their hands revealed.
Sacrifice Seer's Vision: Look at target player's hand and choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery.

cards.name: Shivan Zombie
cards.text: Protection from white
cards.flavor: Barbarians long for a glorious death in battle. Phyrexia was eager to grant that wish.
cards.originalText: Protection from white

cards.name: Simoon
cards.text: Simoon deals 1 damage to each creature target opponent controls.
cards.flavor: Hot wind whipped up as if the weather itself wanted to fight Phyrexians.
cards.originalText: Simoon deals 1 damage to each creature target opponent controls.

cards.name: Sleeper's Robe
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Slinking Serpent
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: It winds its way through undergrowth as easily as it swims through shallows.
cards.originalText: Forestwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a forest.)

cards.name: Smoldering Tar
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, target player loses 1 life.
Sacrifice Smoldering Tar: It deals 4 damage to target creature. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

rulings.text: If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, target player loses 1 life.
Sacrifice Smoldering Tar: Smoldering Tar deals 4 damage to target creature. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery.

cards.name: Spinal Embrace
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during combat.
Untap target creature you don't control and gain control of it. It gains haste until end of turn. At the beginning of the next end step, sacrifice it. If you do, you gain life equal to its toughness.

rulings.text: The sacrifice is mandatory. The last "if you do" only fails if for some reason you could not sacrifice.

cards.originalText:
Play Spinal Embrace only during combat.
Untap target creature you don't control and gain control of it. It gains haste until end of turn. At end of turn, sacrifice it. If you do, you gain life equal to its toughness. (The creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Stalking Assassin
cards.text:
{3}{U}, {T}: Tap target creature.
{3}{B}, {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.originalText:
{3}{U}, {T}: Tap target creature.
{3}{B}, {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.name: Sterling Grove
cards.text:
Other enchantments you control have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
{1}, Sacrifice Sterling Grove: Search your library for an enchantment card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText:
All other enchantments you control can't be the targets of spells or abilities.
{1}, Sacrifice Sterling Grove: Search your library for an enchantment card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

"Isolation is not the answer."
—Urza, to Teferi.
cards.originalText:
As Teferi's Moat comes into play, choose a color.
Creatures of the chosen color without flying can't attack you.

cards.name: Treva, the Renewer
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Treva, the Renewer deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{W}. If you do, choose a color, then you gain 1 life for each permanent of that color.

rulings.text: You choose the color during resolution. This means your opponent does not get to react after knowing the color you chose.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Treva, the Renewer deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{W}. If you do, choose a color. You gain 1 life for each permanent of that color.

cards.name: Tsabo Tavoc
cards.text:
First strike, protection from legendary creatures
{B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target legendary creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: "I might almost pity my enemies—if it wasn't so amusing to watch them die."

rulings.text: The destroy ability only works on legendary creatures, not on other legendary permanents.

cards.originalText:
First strike, protection from Legends
{B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target Legend. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Undermine
cards.text: Counter target spell. Its controller loses 3 life.
cards.flavor: "Which would you like first, the insult or the injury?"
cards.originalText: Counter target spell. Its controller loses 3 life.

cards.name: Urborg Drake
cards.text:
Flying
Urborg Drake attacks each combat if able.
cards.flavor: Relentless as the sea, remorseless as death.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Urborg Drake attacks each turn if able.

cards.name: Vicious Kavu
cards.text: Whenever Vicious Kavu attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: As battle raged in Shiv, a strange new ally appeared from below the ravaged ground.
cards.originalText: Whenever Vicious Kavu attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Vile Consumption
cards.text: All creatures have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this creature unless you pay 1 life."
cards.flavor: The plague moved faster than an army and was far more deadly.
cards.originalText: All creatures have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this creature unless you pay 1 life."

cards.name: Vodalian Zombie
cards.text: Protection from green
cards.flavor:
"Every last one of you will become my servant. It's a shame you won't live to see the irony."
—Tsabo Tavoc, Phyrexian general
cards.originalText: Protection from green

cards.name: Void
cards.text: Choose a number. Destroy all artifacts and creatures with converted mana cost equal to that number. Then target player reveals their hand and discards all nonland cards with converted mana cost equal to the number.

rulings.text: You can choose 0. Artifact lands and most tokens have converted mana costs of 0, for example.
The target player is chosen as you announce Void, but the number isn't chosen until it's resolving. No player may choose to take actions between you choosing a number and the rest of Void's effects.

cards.originalText: Choose a number. Destroy all artifacts and creatures with converted mana cost equal to that number. Then target player reveals his or her hand and discards from it all nonland cards with converted mana cost equal to the number.

First strike

First strike
Whenever Voracious Cobra deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature.

Enchant creature

As Alloy Golem enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Alloy Golem is the chosen color. (It's still an artifact.)
cards.flavor:
"We turned old weapons into new warriors."

rulings.text: If Alloy Golem phases out, you do not pick a new color when it phases in.

cards.originalText:
As Alloy Golem comes into play, choose a color.
Alloy Golem is the chosen color. (It's still an artifact.)

cards.name: Bloodstone Cameo
cards.text: {T}: Add {B} or {R}.
cards.flavor:
"The stone whispers to me of dragon's fire and darkness. I wish I'd never pried it from the figurehead of that sunken Keldon longship."
—Isel, master carver
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Chromatic Sphere
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Chromatic Sphere: Add one mana of any color. Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Let insight and energy be your guides."
—The Blind Seer, to Gerrard

rulings.text: This is a mana ability, which means it can be activated as part of the process of casting a spell or activating another ability. If that happens you get the mana right away, but you don't get to look at the drawn card until you have finished casting that spell or activating that ability.

cards.originalText: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Chromatic Sphere: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Draw a card.

cards.name: Crosis's Attendant
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice Crosis's Attendant: Add {U}{B}{R}.
cards.flavor: "Crosis is the eye of the ur-dragon, piercing illusion and darkness."
cards.originalText: {1}, Sacrifice Crosis's Attendant: Add {U}{B}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Darigaaz's Attendant
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice Darigaaz's Attendant: Add {B}{R}{G}.
cards.flavor: "Darigaaz is the breath of the ur-dragon, burning away the burdens of mortality."
cards.originalText: {1}, Sacrifice Darigaaz's Attendant: Add {B}{R}{G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Drake-Skull Cameo
cards.text: {T}: Add {U} or {B}.
cards.flavor:
"A strange skull was turned up by an Ephran farmer's plow. I traded a copper ring for the 'ox skull.' It resonates of the sea and danger."
—Isel, master carver
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Dromar's Attendant
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice Dromar's Attendant: Add {W}{U}{B}.
cards.flavor: "Dromar is the wings of the ur-dragon, sweeping away all opposition."
cards.originalText: {1}, Sacrifice Dromar's Attendant: Add {W}{U}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Juntu Stakes
cards.text: Creatures with power 1 or less don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
cards.flavor:
"Those who can't survive are of no consequence."
—Tsabo Tavoc
cards.originalText: Creatures with power 1 or less don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

cards.name: Lotus Guardian
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: Lotus fields are too valuable to leave undefended.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Phyrexian Altar
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor:
"Your life was meaningless, but your death will glorify Yawgmoth."
—Tsabo Tavoc
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Phyrexian Lens
cards.text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor:
"There's nothing I wouldn't give to achieve victory. Can you say the same?"
—Tsabo Tavoc, to Gerrard
cards.originalText: {T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Planar Portal
cards.text: {6}, {T}: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The sky split, and the air crackled and roiled. The Phyrexian invasion of Dominaria had finally begun.
cards.originalText: {6}, {T}: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Power Armor
cards.text: Domain — {3}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each basic land type among lands you control.
cards.flavor:
"Great peril demands formidable weaponry."
—Urza

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each basic land type among lands you control.

cards.name: Sparring Golem
cards.text: Whenever Sparring Golem becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
cards.flavor: "Part drill sergeant, part training dummy," thought Gerrard. "I hope it can stand up to a real war."
cards.originalText: Whenever Sparring Golem becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

cards.name: Tek
cards.text: Tek gets +0/+2 as long as you control a Plains, has flying as long as you control an Island, gets +2/+0 as long as you control a Swamp, has first strike as long as you control a Mountain, and has trample as long as you control a Forest.
cards.originalText: Tek gets +0/+2 as long as you control a plains, has flying as long as you control an island, gets +2/+0 as long as you control a swamp, has first strike as long as you control a mountain, and has trample as long as you control a forest.

cards.name: Tsabo's Web
cards.text:
When Tsabo's Web enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Each land with an activated ability that isn't a mana ability doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

rulings.text: A mana ability is an ability that (1) isn't a loyalty ability, (2) doesn't target, and (3) could put mana into a player's mana pool when it resolves.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
When Tsabo's Web comes into play, draw a card.
Lands with an activated ability that doesn't produce mana don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
